or it could be a combination of both but
the end result is the same legitimate
users are denied access to your website

the site that you're attacking if you

and the types of UDP services you see
out in the Internet includes ntp
services DNS services they have they

accept in so you get an amplification

this is where an attacker will initiate

and these can run to tens of gigabits
per second and they could be quite

attacks have a common stick signature
and are easier to detect and therefore

then we see layer 7 attacks and also

AWS is to remove the undifferentiated
heavy lifting for our customers so we
can look across all their customer base
and we can see the common problems and
challenges that our customers have and
if we can provide a service that
mitigates or helps customers with this

of automating it templating it whatever
we'll try and remove the heavy lifting
and all of our services we also
to make them highly available so that
your customers and your users are always
able to get to your websites and we
launched it reinvent 2016 AWS shield
service this wasn't something we bought
and bolted onto our infrastructure it's
built into infrastructure it's tightly
integrated using all the api's that you
you know and love about AWS we wanted it
to be always on so we didn't want when
you're under attack you had to make a
phone call you had to switch on
mitigation so we want this to be there
all the time for you and we want it to
be available for customers both big and
small so that if you use more if you're
protecting more traffic you pay more if
you're using less you pay for less and
of course it needs to be flexible so
attackers are always changing the way
they attack your infrastructure in your
site so our service also needs to be
flexible and the AWS shield service has
two tiers of operation and has shield
standard and shield advanced if you're
behind a cloud front distribution if
your website's behind a cloud front
distribution in Sydney you are protected
already you're protected against 96% of
the most common DDoS attacks that we see
